channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Bank of England presses pause on rate cuts, highlights 'gradual approach'
item.description: The decision to hold comes after the U.S. Federal Reserve kicked off its own monetary easing with an aggressive 50 basis point rate cut.

item.title: Amazon introduces Amelia, an AI assistant for third-party sellers
item.description: Amelia is the latest generative AI product from Amazon, which is using the technology across its retail portfolio.

item.title: What buying Commerzbank would mean for UniCredit — and the banking sector
item.description: Analysts have welcomed the move by UniCredit, particularly because a tie-up between the two banks might spur more M&A activity in Europe's banking sector.

item.title: How Fed rate cuts affect the global economy
item.description: Federal Reserve interest rate decisions can influence the trajectory of the U.S. economy and create spillover effects in parts of the global financial system.

item.title: China's Alibaba launches over 100 new open-source AI models, releases text-to-video generation tool
item.description: Alibaba is hoping its latest AI offerings may tempt customers around the world to sign up to its cloud services.

item.title: Billionaire tech CEO says bosses shouldn't 'BS' employees about the impact AI will have on jobs
item.description: Business leaders shouldn't "BS" employees about the impact of AI on jobs, according to one tech billionaire, who says they should be transparent and honest.

item.title: China would love a domestic Nvidia rival — but that's proving quite the challenge
item.description: Chinese firms face a number of challenges in trying to rival Nvidia including contending with U.S. export restrictions and a lack of tech expertise.

item.title: 'We can’t allow the cultural infrastructure to literally crumble': One of London's most popular arts attractions needs a $200 million fix
item.description: The Southbank Centre in London needs more than $200 million to repair its concert halls and gallery as it heads toward its 75-year anniversary.

item.title: Japan faces labor shortages and demographic crisis as elderly population hits record high
item.description: Japan's number of people aged 65 and over has reached a record high, cementing it as the worlds most elderly country, according to government statistics.

item.title: Ray Dalio says the Fed has a tough balancing act as the economy faces 'enormous amount of debt'
item.description: On Wednesday, Dalio listed debt, money and the economic cycle as one of the top five forces influencing the global economy.

item.title: Ray Dalio calls upcoming U.S. election the most consequential of his lifetime
item.description: Speaking to CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia" on Thursday, the founder of Bridgewater Associates explained that what the U.S. needs is "broad-based prosperity."

item.title: Binance CEO says crypto exchange saw 40% growth this year in institutional, corporate investors
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has seen a 40% increase this year in institutional and corporate investors, CEO Richard Teng told CNBC's Lin Lin.

item.title: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
item.description: Here's how the central bank's policy statement changed for its September rate decision.

item.title: Boeing starts furloughing tens of thousands of employees amid machinist strike
item.description: CEO Kelly Ortberg said affected employees would take one week of furlough every four weeks for the strike's duration and he and his team would take pay cuts.

item.title: Taiwan manufacturer rejects links to Lebanon's exploding pager attacks, names Hungarian firm
item.description: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.

item.title: Will the U.S. elections impact crypto markets? Insiders weigh in
item.description: Crypto insiders on Wednesday downplayed the importance of of the U.S. presidential race on the market at the annual TOKEN2049 event in Singapore.

item.title: 111 Republican former officials endorse Harris, say Trump is 'unfit to serve'
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign has netted Republican endorsements from numerous Trump administration officials as well as from figures such as Dick Cheney.

item.title: Powell downplays impact of rate cut on Trump-Harris presidential race
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are each fighting to persuade voters they are best candidate for the U.S. economy.

item.title: Novartis not joining the 'frenzy' of weight loss drugs, CEO says
item.description: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Novartis said Wednesday that it does not plan to enter into the "frenzy" of weight loss drugs.

item.title: JPMorgan creates new role overseeing junior bankers as Wall Street wrestles with workload concerns
item.description: The move shows how JPMorgan Chase, the biggest American investment bank by revenue, is responding to the latest untimely death on Wall Street.

item.title: European markets close lower ahead of Fed rate decision
item.description: European markets fell on Wednesday as investors considered key data and looked ahead to the Federal Reserve interest rate decision.

item.title: Google wins court challenge to the EU's $1.7 billion antitrust fine over ad product
item.description: The European Union's second-highest court on Wednesday said a 1.5 billion euro ($1.7 billion) antitrust fine imposed on Google by regulators should be annulled.

item.title: UK inflation holds steady in August, matching expectations
item.description: U.K. inflation came in at 2.2% for the month of August, data from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Hoping for a 50-basis-point cut
item.description: Hope versus reality: That’s the mood among market watchers as we count down to the Fed’s interest rate decision.

item.title: Oil stares at a bleak future as China's economy sputters. The good news: A market 'bust' is unlikely
item.description: Lower oil prices were the dominant theme in Asia's largest oil conference. The question was not whether oil will go lower, but mostly by how much will it decline in the coming years.

item.title: Trump says he will meet with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi next week
item.description: Modi will partake in the fourth Quad Leaders' Summit in Wilmington, Delaware and attend the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

item.title: These are the '50 best hotels' in the world for 2024
item.description: Capella Bangkok is 2024's 'best' hotel in the world, according to a new ranking by the 50 Best organization.

item.title: Harris victory seen as most likely election outcome, according to CNBC Fed Survey
item.description: The survey was taken several days after the first and possibly only debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

item.title: Microsoft, BlackRock form group to raise $100 billion to invest in AI data centers and power
item.description: Microsoft, BlackRock and Abu Dhabi's investment vehicle are aiming to initially raise $30 billion to invest in AI data centers and the energy to power them.

item.title: The Bank of Japan's next rate hike may come in December, not this week: CNBC survey
item.description: CNBC surveyed economists, FX strategists and Japan-focused fund managers on their BOJ expectations and year-end forecast for the yen.
